title: colors​
content: </> Hue.colors: table An assortment of predefined, accessible colors based off of the research in "Mutually Arising: Improving accessibility in Discord team role color contrast (2021)," found here: https://sibr.dev/research.html

title: fromHex​
content: </> Hue.fromHex( hex: string-- A hexadecimal string representing a color ) → Color3 -- Returns the Color3 equivalent of the hex string Converts a given hex string into a Color3. The hex string can optionall start with a hash # but it is not required. You can also optionally use short, 3 character hex codes for convenience. fromHex("#fff") fromHex("#f0f0f0") fromHex("ff3685")

title: grayscale​
content: </> Hue.grayscale( color: Color3 -- The color to convert to grayscale ) → Color3 -- Returns a new grayscale Color3 based off color Creates a new color in grayscale. Ever wanted to make a black and white film? Well now you can.

title: isDark​
content: </> Hue.isDark( color: Color3 -- The color to check ) → boolean-- Returns true if color is perceived to be dark, false otherwise Checks if the given color is considered to be "dark." That is, a color that contrasts well with bright colors.

title: isLight​
content: </> Hue.isLight( color: Color3 -- The color to check ) → boolean-- Returns true if color is perceived to be light, false otherwise Checks if the given color is considered to be "light." That is, a color that contrasts well with dark colors.

title: negate​
content: </> Hue.negate( color: Color3 -- The color to check ) → Color3 -- Returns an inverse of color Negates the given color
